required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Advanced Bradycardia Device Feature Utilization and Clinical Outcomes II
clinical_study.official_title: Advanced Bradycardia Device Feature Utilization and Clinical Outcomes II

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to characterize the utilization of diagnostics capabilities in St. Jude Medical pacemakers to manage patients with a standard bradycardia pacing indication.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study is a prospective, non-randomized, multi-center observational study designed to evaluate the utilization of diagnostic capabilities, indications, MRI scanning capabilities and clinical outcomes of patients implanted with SJM pacemakers.
The total duration of the study is expected to be approximately 30 months. The clinical study will be conducted in up to 160 centers across Europe, Middle East, Africa, (EMEA region) and Asia, Australia and New Zealand (Asia-Pac region). Approximately 2016 subjects will be enrolled in this study. Subjects will be followed for 1 year after pacemaker implant.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complications in the General Pacemaker Population
primary_outcome.description: The rate of device related adverse events that require a medical intervention and/or hospitalization for treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Programmed With Advanced Pacemaker Features
secondary_outcome.description: Advanced pacemaker features include Autocapture, Auto sensitivity control (ASC), Ventricular Intrinsic Preference (VIP®), Patient Notifier, RF telemetry, and newer advanced features.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Pacemaker Patients With Atrial Tachycardia/Fibrillation (AT/AF), Ventricular Tachycardia/Fibrillation (VT/VF), Pacemaker-mediated Tachycardia (PMT) and Automatic Mode Switching (AMS) Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: At each follow-up, devices were interrogated and device session records were uploaded. Episodes of AT/AF, VT/VF, PMT and AMS were measured by the pacemakers diagnostics features.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of MRI Scans by Country
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of scans performed by country

intervention.intervention_name: Patients implanted with a St. Jude Medical pacemakers

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a standard bradycardia pacing indication and implanted with a St. Jude Medical pacemaker

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have been implanted with an SJM Assurity MRI™, Endurity MRI™ or other SJM MRI compatible pacemakers in the EMEA region within 30 days or patients implanted with an Accent MRI™, Assurity MRI™, Endurity MRI™ or other SJM MRI compatible pacemakers in the Asia-Pac region within 30 days.
- Patient is geographically stable and willing to comply with the required follow-up schedule.
- Patient is not pregnant or planning to become pregnant during the course of the study.
- Patient is > 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's life expectancy is less than 1 year

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Programmed With Advanced Pacemaker Features
outcome.description: Advanced pacemaker features include Autocapture, Auto sensitivity control (ASC), Ventricular Intrinsic Preference (VIP®), Patient Notifier, RF telemetry, and newer advanced features.
outcome.population: All study participants that completed that 12-month visit and had the feature enabled for the duration of the study. Subjects that had a change in the status of the feature (e.g. ON to OFF) are not included in the count shown here.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
